alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 2:45PM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Light to moderate showers are redeveloping over the area, and flooding is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roadways, creeks, and streams are expected, including the Arroyo Grande Creek. In addition, there is an ongoing significant risk of mud and rockslides, especially on canyon roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to moderate rain. Multiple road closures due to flooding have been reported throughout the county. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since last night. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Santa Margarita, Black Mountain, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, and Templeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
